abstract: Returns an `NSBundle` object initialized to correspond to the specified directory.
overview:
## Return Value

An `NSBundle` object initialized to correspond to `fullPath`. This method initializes and returns a new instance only if there is no existing bundle associated with `fullPath`, otherwise it deallocates `self` and returns the existing object. If `fullPath` doesn’t exist or the user doesn’t have access to it, returns `nil`.

## Discussion

It’s not necessary to allocate and initialize an instance for the main bundle; use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Bundle/main] class method to get this instance. You can also use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSBundle/bundleWithPath:] class method to obtain a bundle identified by its directory path.

# init(path:)

**Initializer**

Returns an `NSBundle` object initialized to correspond to the specified directory.

## Declaration

```swift
init?(path: String)
```

## Parameters

- **path**: The path to a directory. This must be a full pathname for a directory; if it contains any symbolic links, they must be resolvable.

## Return Value

An `NSBundle` object initialized to correspond to `fullPath`. This method initializes and returns a new instance only if there is no existing bundle associated with `fullPath`, otherwise it deallocates `self` and returns the existing object. If `fullPath` doesn’t exist or the user doesn’t have access to it, returns `nil`.

## Discussion

It’s not necessary to allocate and initialize an instance for the main bundle; use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Bundle/main] class method to get this instance. You can also use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSBundle/bundleWithPath:] class method to obtain a bundle identified by its directory path.

## Creating and Initializing a Bundle

- **init(for:)**: Returns the `NSBundle` object with which the specified class is associated.
- **init(identifier:)**: Returns the `NSBundle` instance that has the specified bundle identifier.
- **init(url:)**: Returns an `NSBundle` object initialized to correspond to the specified file URL.
